page.title: 01Barkby, Syston & Thurmaston.
page.content: These 3 villages, together with the hamlet of Barkby Thorpe, lie to the NE of Leicester. Originally they were very separate but now Leicester, Thurmaston and Syston form a continuous built up area along the {Melton Road}(A 607). The{Six Hills Road}(A 46 -Fosse Way) now bypasses Thurmaston on its way to Newarke and Lincoln. Running parallel to this is the{River Soar}and the {Grand Union Canal.}Few roads run East to West due to the extensive water- meadows by the river which floods regularly. Syston is the only village in the group to have had a railway station but this is now closed. Thurmaston used to have two sets of private sidings serving the brickworks but these too have disappeared.
